reviews.text: We bought these to replace our old smart home switches that no longer functioned as they should. Pros: -zero issues so far. Which is a big change from previous brand. -the click is nice -easy to install -I like that switch has a small circle light that lights when off so you can see them in the dark. -easy to use with Siri/homekit -price -when turning them off you have a setting that you can have it dim until off instead of just on to off. Which gives you time to fully exit the room. Cons: -none so far
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2025
reviews.title: The Smart Switch

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I have installed approximately 20 Kasa HomeKit dimmable switches in my home. They work great with old school incandescent bulbs. However, as I switch a room over to LED bulbs (GU10, MR16 type), each time I have encountered noticeable flickering until the bulb is driven to approx. 60%, so their effective dimmable range is not great in my experience. I have tried multiple bulb vendors with no success yet - despite all claiming to be dimmable. Just be aware that the dimming on these switches is known as Triac Phase Forward (aka Leading Edge) so be sure that you know what bulbs support that dimming approach.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2025
reviews.title: Have not found LED dimmable bulbs that dont flicker with this switch

Installation was so straightforward that my wife, who isnâ€™t particularly handy, had no trouble setting them up. The only reason Iâ€™m giving it 4 stars is that the switch plate didnâ€™t seem to latch on tightly, which was a bit frustrating. Otherwise, highly recommend for anyone looking to upgrade their smart home!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025

reviews.text: These were very simple for an electrician like me to install. Getting them acquainted with my Apple HomeKit was also a breeze after figuring out that I just needed to tap on an option that let me enter the code on the switch. I love the scenes and the ability to automate my lights and my life.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2025
reviews.title: Wonderful improvement

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I initially passed over these lights because I'm not an Apple product user and have no intention of using Apple Home Kit. I had wired another brand of smart switches throughout my entire house that were maybe 15% cheaper but I could also find them at Home Depot. The switches I installed were not compatible with my local network and home automation software. They also dropped network connection everyday, the app was cheap and barely worked, and the dimming stuttered. So I bought these Kasa switches and other 3-Way switches, and just finished installing all of them. It is anmight and day difference. Kasa app is extremely easy to use, the options for customization are amazing, the operation of the dimmer is so smooth it's easy on the eyes. Better yet, they are all working with a third party home automation program I was hoping to use. If you are in the market and hoping to add Kasa products to your home just buy these. Save yourself the hassle of buying, installing, uninstalling, and returning cheaper alternatives.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2025
reviews.title: Worth the Money

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: 1-They are connected correctly. Don't connect them the way you "think" they go, use a meter or a voltage tester on existing wiring. It has to be connected correctly. 2-Set up a separate 2.4 G network. Don't try connecting into your regular Wi-Fi. Create a new Wi-Fi network on your router and call it something else. Do not add 5G to it, only 2.4. They seem to integrate well with Apple HomeKit, Brilliant Lighting and Control4. I know this only because I am an install tech and have been dealing with the Headache that goes along with this crap for 20+ years.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2025
reviews.title: They work great IFâ€¦

reviews.text: As a dumb switch, this is a pretty good design. As a smart switch, this product is the worst. Entire pairing implementation is horribly botched. And if that wasnâ€™t enough, TP link, the Chinese company that manufactures these switches has been implicated in DDOS campaigns against US facilities. Itâ€™s unclear if the company is working with the Chinese national government. Problems with the app, HomeKit, implementation, pairing, Wi-Fi compatibility, all too numerous to list.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: We did these all over our house. We have 3 way dimmers, single dimmers, motion switches, single non dimmers etc. They all function flawlessly. Alexa imports them easily into our smart home environment. We don't have the issues we had with the treat life switches that lost connection or wouldn't dim periodically. You do need the neutral so make sure you have it. Outside that, setup is less than 3 minutes a switch including install. You can set groups, schedules, last mode, long and double press options. I try to keep all my smart functions in one platform to avoid overlapping rules. So set the light up in the kasa app. Then schedule in the alexa app. The hardest part is coming up with a good naming convention but we have some weird single lights that we now make function from one switch or command when we want
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2024
reviews.title: Kasa switches are great!

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: I recently bought these HomeKit capable dimmer switches to replace the WeMo dimmers I have been using until now. A couple of months ago, the WeMo dimmers simply stopped working correctly. No matter what I tried to reset them and reconfigure them, they refused to work. So I decided to give these Kasa dimmers a try since they were so highly rated here. Wow! These things are fantastic! The software set up is far superior. It is designed better. It looks really good. And the software does what it is supposed to. It works and it works well. The dimmers work excellently and I have zero complaints. Much more than I can say for the Wemo dimmers. I also bought a few of the Kasa smart plugs. They were a breeze to set up and work flawlessly. Going forward,, I will only be buying this Kasa brand. I highly recommend them. You will not be disappointed. By the way, these dimmers and smart plugs cost much less than the competition with no sacrifice in quality at all.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
reviews.title: Iâ€™m switching to Kasa!

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Apple HomeKit Smart Dimmer Switch KS220P3, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required,2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Works with Siri, Alexa and Google Home,UL Certified, No Hub Required,White, 3 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews.text: The switch is working well. My favorite thing about this switch is that I was able to make a Smart Action then when turned off automatically triggers my basement light switch to turn on. This allows me to come out of my basement bedroom into the basement hallway and be able to see my way upstairs since that switch is located upstairs and has 20m motion sensor. I've created other Smart Actions to shut down specific Kasa Power Strip outlets to turn off the space heater, heated blanket, monitors, etc. and this is awesome!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2024
